all manifesting their faces, they said this together:
Excellent, excellent!
Buddha-son!

Now those tathÄgata buddhas from the ten directions, each as numerous as the dust particles in ten koá¹­Ä«s of buddha-fields, jointly empower you. By the power of the majestic virtue of the original vow of the World-Honored Vairocana, for all bodhisattvas to enter and manifest the inconceivable light of the Buddha's teachings,

In the stage of all wisdoms, in order to embrace all wholesome roots, to skillfully discern all Buddha-dharmas, to extensively know the Dharma, to correctly expound the well-established Dharma, to attain the purity of non-discriminating wisdom, to be unstained by the Dharma of MÄra, to purify the wholesome roots of supramundane dharmas, to realize the realm of inconceivable wisdom, and to realize the realm of the wisdom of the Buddhas;

It is for the sake of causing all bodhisattvas to generate the ten grounds and attain them, for the sake of correctly explaining the bodhisattva grounds and establishing skillful means, for the sake of properly contemplating the wondrous Dharma of the buddhas, for the sake of cultivating the distinctions of the uncontaminated Dharma, for the sake of skillfully selecting and discerning the great wisdom and light of certainty, for the sake of entering the gate of certain knowledge, for the sake of attaining fearless eloquence in displaying and revealing as appropriate, for the sake of realizing the ground of vast unobstructed understanding, for the sake of not forgetting the thought of enlightenment, for the sake of skillfully ripening the realm of sentient beings, for the sake of penetrating and discerning eloquence in all places.
However, good man!
You should expound this Dharma gate of skillful means for the distinctions of this Dharma.
Namely:

Because they receive the power of the majestic numen of the buddhas, because they are empowered by the wisdom light of the tathÄgatas, because they have well and completely purified their own roots of goodness, because they have well adorned the true Dharma realm, because they have universally benefited all sentient beings, because they have realized the wisdom that is the basis of the Dharma body, because they have received the consecration of the buddhas, because they have already manifested the greatest body that surpasses all worlds, because they have transcended all worldly destinies, because they have purified the supramundane destiny of the true Dharma, because they are able to perfect the cognition of omniscience.

At that time, the TathÄgatas of the ten directions bestowed upon Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva an unoverpowered body, unobstructed eloquence in expounding the Dharma, entry into subtle and pure wisdom and eloquence, the empowerment of mindfulness without forgetfulness, skillful wisdom of excellent determination, the wisdom of universal practice that is not abandoned, the power of perfect enlightenment that cannot be crushed, the fearlessness of the TathÄgata that is free from timidity, the great unobstructed eloquence and Dharma principles determined and established by the wisdom of omniscience, and the adornment of the well-discriminated body, speech, and mind that inspires all TathÄgatas.
Why is it so?

By this, the bodhisattva attains the samÄdhi of the light of the Great Vehicle. It is so by the nature of things, because it is aroused by the power of original vows, because of the pure, superior, and marvelous intention, because of the well-polished wheel of pure wisdom, because of the well-accumulated provisions, because of the well-refined work, because of the immeasurable mindfulness that is the vessel, because the bright and superior understanding attains purity, because of well-penetrating the unmixed dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gate, and because of being sealed by the wisdom seal of the Dharma realm.
At that time, the Buddha-BhagavÄns of the ten directions, without rising from their seats, each extended their right hand and rubbed the crown of the head of the great bodhisattva Vajra Treasury.

When the bodhisattva Vajra Treasury was touched on the crown of the head by the Buddhas of the ten directions, he immediately arose from samÄdhi and addressed the entire assembly of bodhisattvas, saying:
Only, O Buddha-sons!
This bodhisattva vow is definite, unadulterated, inconceivable, vast as the Dharma realm, extending to the end of space, lasting to the end of the future, able to save all sentient beings.
Only, all good people!

The bodhisattva, having settled in this vow, is then able to enter the wisdom ground of the past buddhas, is able to enter the wisdom ground of the future buddhas, and is also able to enter the wisdom ground of the present buddhas.
Only, all good people!

All bodhisattvas have ten wisdom grounds, and therefore the buddhas of the past, future, and present have already explained, will explain, and are now explaining. For this secret meaning, I speak thus.
What are the ten?

The first is called the ground of extreme joy, the second is called the ground of being free from defilements, the third is called the ground of blazing wisdom, the fourth is called the ground of difficult to conquer, the fifth is called the ground of being face to face, the sixth is called the ground of going far, the seventh is called the ground of immovable, the eighth is called the ground of excellent wisdom, and the tenth is called the ground of the cloud of Dharma.
Only, O Buddha's disciples!
This is called the ten grounds of all bodhisattvas.
Therefore, the buddhas of the past, future, and present have already taught, will teach, and are now teaching.
Only, O Buddha's disciples!
I do not see any buddha-lands where the tathÄgatas do not praise and teach these ten grounds of the bodhisattvas.
Why is this?
This is because these bodhisattvas' supreme and wondrous ability to purify all the bodhisattva paths and the light of the Dharma, namely the ten grounds, is established and explained.
Only, O Buddha's disciples!

One should know that this place is inconceivable, namely the wisdom of one's own realization in the establishment and teaching of the grounds.ğŸ”½At that time, having proclaimed the names of the ten grounds, Bodhisattva Vajra Treasury remained silent and did not further analyze and explain them.
At that time, the assembly of all bodhisattvas, having heard the names of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas but not hearing the explanations, all gave rise to longing thoughts and had this thought:
For what causes and conditions does the Bodhisattva Vajra Treasury, having only spoken the names of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas, remain silent and not further explain?

At that time, within this assembly of bodhisattvas there was a bodhisattva named Liberation Moon, who knew the thoughts in the minds of the great assembly and immediately asked the Bodhisattva Vajra Treasury in verse:
Why does the one who has realized true enlightenment, endowed with the merit of wisdom and thought,
Proclaim the supreme and wondrous grounds, yet remain silent and not explain?
All are certain that the bodhisattvas are of great renown;
Why speak the names of the grounds yet not expound their meaning?
All the Buddha's disciples, fearless, all delight in hearing;
Please explain and analyze, speaking of the meaning and purport of the grounds.
The assembly is pure, free from laziness and dignified,
Fresh and clean, abiding in solidity, endowed with merit and wisdom;
They all looked at each other with respect, and all focused their gaze;
They only hoped for the sweet dew of the Dharma, like bees thinking of pure honey.
The one of great wisdom and fearlessness, Vajra Treasury, hearing this,
Wished to delight the great assembly, and responded to the Buddha's disciples with a verse, saying:
Although it is the most supreme and extremely rare, it can manifest the bodhisattva practices;
The explanation of the stages can create the most subtle, and by this the Buddha stage has cultivation and realization.
It is subtle, difficult to see, and free from discrimination, far removed from the mind ground, difficult to realize and awaken to;
It is the realm of the wise, purely without outflows, and those who hear it in the world will all be confused.
With a mind at ease, unmoving like vajra, believing and understanding the Buddha's wisdom to be most supreme;
Clearly knowing that there is no self, only the mind ground, one can hear this subtle wisdom.
It is like using various colors to paint space, like the wind relying on the path of birds to move;
The untainted Buddha-wisdom is also like this, although it is discriminated, it is difficult to see.
Therefore, I now give rise to such wisdom, few in the world can know this;
And those who can believe in this supreme Dharma, therefore, are not suitable for extensive explanation.
At that time, Bodhisattva Liberation Moon, having heard these words, said to Bodhisattva Vajra Treasury:
Buddha's disciple!

The assembly here is all pure. The bodhisattvas have a well-purified intention, a well-purified thought, and have well cultivated practices. They have already well served innumerable hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of buddhas, well accumulated provisions, and accomplished various merits. They are forever free from doubt and have no defilements. They well abide in the superior intention and resolve, and in the Buddha's teachings, they do not follow the teachings of others.
Excellent!
Buddha's disciple, expound this meaning. These bodhisattvas directly realize and abide in such places.
At that time, the Bodhisattva Vimukti-candra, wishing to restate this meaning, spoke a verse, saying:
Please explain the most peaceful and blissful, the unsurpassed practice of the bodhisattvas;
Discern the various stages, with pure wisdom accomplishing perfect enlightenment.
This assembly is free from all defilements, their aspirations and understanding are all pure and clear;
They have served immeasurable buddhas and are able to understand the meaning of this stage.
At that time, the Bodhisattva Vajra Treasury said:
Buddha's disciples!

Although this assembly is all pure, the bodhisattvas have a well-purified intention, a well-purified thought, and well-cultivated practices. They have already been able to serve immeasurable hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of buddhas, well-accumulated provisions, and accomplished various merits. They are forever free from doubt and defilement, well-abiding in the superior intention and understanding, and in the Buddha's teachings, they do not follow the teachings of others.

However, there are other sentient beings with inferior understanding who, upon hearing this extremely profound and inconceivable realm, will suddenly give rise to doubt, which will lead them for a long time to what is meaningless, disadvantageous, and full of suffering.
I have compassion for them and therefore prefer to remain silent.
At that time, Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva, wishing to restate this meaning, spoke a verse, saying:ğŸ”½Although this assembly is pure and vast in wisdom,

At that time, Liberation Moon Bodhisattva again addressed Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva, saying:

Please speak without doubt.
By the Buddha's spiritual power and the Buddha's protection, all such inconceivable matters can be believed.
Why is it so?

When expounding these ten grounds and their explanations, it is naturally so that all Buddhas protect and think of them, and all Bodhisattvas, in order to guard this ground of wisdom, all give rise to courage and valor.

This is the Bodhisattvas' initial correct practice, and it is also the cultivation and realization of all Buddha-dharmas.
Only the Buddha's disciples!

It is like all written characters, numbers, and explanations, which begin with the alphabet and end with the alphabet, without the slightest written character, number, or explanation that is apart from the alphabet.

All Buddha-dharmas are also like this, taking the grounds as the beginning because they initiate the practice, and taking the grounds as the end because they realize the Buddha's wisdom.

I wish you to expound it, the Buddhas, the Worthy Ones, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, who empower and protect it.

Displaying the subtle and vast practices, distinguishing and establishing the stages of wisdom.
If there are those who hear this supreme Dharma gateway, they will also be protected by the Well-Gone One;
All bodhisattvas in the ten directions will all embrace and protect them with their thoughts.
They will be able to cultivate all correct practices, gradually perfecting the stainless grounds;
They will be able to realize the merits and virtues of the ten powers, and awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
Even if they dwell in the ocean waters or the fire of the eon, without doubt they are able to hear this Dharma gateway;
Will never again hear such a teaching.ğŸ”½I will now explain the supreme path of wisdom of the stages,
The realization, abiding, and advancement;ğŸ”½The realms of practice will be explained in sequence,
For the sake of benefiting and delighting all sentient beings.

At that time, Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva observed the ten directions, wishing to increase the pure faith of the great assembly, and spoke a verse, saying:ğŸ”½The path of the great sage is subtle and difficult to know,
Unobservable and beyond discrimination;ğŸ”½Difficult to realize, the realm of the untainted wisdom,
Its nature always tranquil, without arising or ceasing.ğŸ”½The nature of emptiness is able to pacify, non-dual and exhaustive,
Free from destinies, equal, reaching nirvana;
Boundless, with no object to be realized in the middle, transcending the three times, equal to space.ğŸ”½Tranquil and extinguished, realized by the Buddha,

Difficult to explain, let alone listen to!
Far removed from the path of thought and mind, this wisdom leads to the realm of the Sage;
Not revealed by the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, not measured by the mind, not contemplated by the intellect.
Like the traces of birds in the sky, the wise ones cannot express or demonstrate them;
The stages of the Buddha's disciples are also like this, extremely difficult to speak of, let alone listen to!
Now I will only speak of this one part, due to great compassion and the power of vows;
According to their gradual sequence, not the realm of the mind, wisdom can fulfill one's wishes.
Such a realm is extremely difficult to see, inexpressible, abiding only in one's own delight;
Yet relying on the Buddha's power, I now speak - you all listen with single-minded respect.
Such wisdom gates and right practices, even if proclaimed for billions of eons, are still difficult to exhaust;
I will now speak briefly - you all listen, the true meaning of the Dharma is all in accordance with reason.
You should single-mindedly respectfully await, I will skillfully expound by the Buddha's power;
Proclaiming the subtle and correct Dharma sounds, with parables corresponding and in proper sequence.
This is difficult to express in words, yet relying on the immeasurable Buddha's spiritual power;
The light forms gather into my body, therefore I can now expound.
Only, all Buddha sons!

If there are sentient beings who have well accumulated wholesome roots, well gathered provisions, well cultivated practices, well served the Buddhas, well amassed pure dharmas, are embraced by good friends, have well purified intentions, and follow the vast and supreme intentions;

They have marvelous understanding and compassion, and in order to seek the Buddha's wisdom, to realize the power of the ten powers, to attain the great fearlessness of the TathÄgata, to attain the equality of the Buddha's unique qualities, to save all worlds, to purify great compassion, to realize the unobstructed wisdom of the ten directions, to purify all buddha-lands without obstruction, to be able to know the three times in a single instant, and to turn the great Dharma wheel without fear, they give rise to such a mind.

The bodhisattvas' initial resolve is guided by great compassion, with wisdom and cognition as the superior [factor], and is embraced by skillful means. It is always supported by intention and superior intention, and is upheld by the immeasurable power of the Buddha, the power of resolve, and the power of wisdom. It is well-chosen and certain, with unobstructed cognition manifest, in accord with the marvelous wisdom that is self-taught without a teacher. It is able to receive the wisdom of the Buddha's teachings, instructing and revealing to the utmost extent of the Dharma realm, to the end of space, and to the end of the future.

From the initial arising of this mind, they are already bodhisattvas who transcend the stage of ordinary beings, realize and enter the correct nature of separation from birth as bodhisattvas, are born in the TathÄgata's family, with a noble lineage and nothing to be criticized, have already left the worldly path and entered the supramundane path, abide in the fundamental nature of bodhisattvas, have already well-abided in the place of bodhisattvas, accord with the Dharma of equality throughout the three times, and succeed to the TathÄgata's lineage, definitely heading towards perfect enlightenment.
Only, all Buddha-sons!
Bodhisattvas abiding in such dharmas are called those who have well-abided in the ground of extreme joy, because they are unshakable.
Only, all Buddha-sons!

When bodhisattvas abide in the ground of extreme joy, they have much joy, much pure faith, much love, much delight, much happiness, much exuberance, much courage, much non-contentiousness, much non-harming, and much non-hatred.
Only, all Buddha-sons!
When bodhisattvas dwell in the ground of extreme joy, when they think of the buddhas, they give rise to extreme joy;

when they think of the Buddha's teachings, when they think of the bodhisattvas, when they think of the bodhisattva practices, when they think of the purity of the perfections, when they think of the supremacy of the bodhisattva grounds, when they think of not being outshone by other bodhisattvas, when they think of the buddhas' instructions and admonitions, when they think of bringing benefit to sentient beings, and when they think of entering into the practice of the wisdom of all tathÄgatas, they all give rise to joy.

Moreover, this bodhisattva knows that he is now turning away from all worldly realms, drawing near to the buddhas and far from the stage of differences, approaching the stage of wisdom, forever cutting off all the dangerous evil destinies, and becoming a place of reliance for all sentient beings.
Approaching the buddhas, he dwells in the buddhas' realm and enters into the equality of all bodhisattvas, abandoning all fears and horripilation, and therefore gives rise to extreme joy.
Why is this?
Only, O Buddha-sons!
As soon as a bodhisattva realizes the ground of extreme joy, all fears, namely:
fear of not surviving, fear of bad reputation, fear of death, fear of bad destinies, and fear of being timid in crowds, are all completely eliminated.
Why is this?
Because this bodhisattva is free from the notion of self, he does not even have self-love, let alone love for various possessions;
for this reason, he has no fear of not surviving.
Because he has no expectations from others, he only arouses the desire within himself to provide all sentient beings with the necessities of life;
for this reason, he has no fear of bad reputation.
Because he is free from the view of self, he has no notion of loss in the self, and therefore has no fear of death.
He knows for himself that after death, in the future he will definitely not be separated from the buddhas and bodhisattvas;
for this reason, he has no fear of bad destinies.

Because of their intention and view, they think, In all worlds, there is not a single person equal to me, let alone one who is superior. Therefore, they have no fear or timidity when facing an assembly.
Only the Buddha's disciples!

The bodhisattvas are like this. Having already eliminated fear, arrogance, and horripilation, with great compassion as their guide, without aversion or worldly intentions, they diligently cultivate in order to cultivate and realize all wholesome roots.
With increased faith, with much purity, with pure understanding, with much faith and understanding,

with the arousal of compassion, with the fulfillment of great kindness, with an untiring mind, with the adornment of shame and remorse, with always being patient and gentle, with deeply respecting and revering the TathÄgata's holy teachings, with being insatiable and accumulating all wholesome roots day and night,
with serving good friends, with delighting in the Dharma garden, with being insatiable and seeking much learning,
The Dharma they hear is contemplated in accordance with principle, with an unattached mind, not indulging in fame,
profit, and respect, not longing for the requisites of life, with an inexhaustible mind of equality like a precious pearl,
exclusively aspiring to the stage of omniscience, with the TathÄgata's powers,
fearlessnesses, and unique qualities as the object, seeking the unattached perfections,
free from flattery and deceit, practicing as one speaks, always guarding the truth, not defiling the Buddha's family,

encouraging others, not abandoning the bodhisattva practices, with the mind of universal knowledge unshakable like a great mountain king, not apart from worldly affairs yet able to accomplish the supramundane
path, cultivating the requisites of enlightenment without weariness, always aspiring to the superior Dharma in the future.
Only the Buddha's disciples!
In accordance with these pure stages of the Dharma, the bodhisattva is called abiding in the stage of extreme joy.
